tweet: Our office appreciates all the efforts of legislators to address the problems we’re seeing in mobile home communities, but this current compromise bill doesn’t address the biggest issues that brought everyone to the table.

name: IA Attorney General
tweet: Lisa’s dedication and knowledge of on-going scams were vital in this situation. Congratulations to Lisa for being named a 2022 AG Consumer Protection Hero! #NCPW2022   Learn more about phone scams here:     https://t.co/rI0tKoZZdk

name: IA Attorney General
tweet: To have her name removed from the car title, she needed to get cash, go to Hy-Vee, and have money sent to the caller. Lisa told the woman this was a scam and helped the woman to block the number.

name: IA Attorney General
tweet: The woman pointed to her pocket, said she was still on the phone and that the person who had called could continue to hear her conversations. The customer said she’d received a call from someone in Texas claiming that a vehicle she previously owned was involved in drug dealing.

name: IA Attorney General
tweet: When the woman asked to withdraw $8,500 from her account, Lisa asked a few extra questions, recognizing this was not a normal activity for the customer. The woman whispered to Lisa that she was told not to talk about the situation with anyone, even her family.

name: IA Attorney General
tweet: Lisa Hoerschelmann takes the time to get to know her customers at 1st Gateway Credit Union in Clinton. That’s why last year an out of the ordinary interaction with a woman caused Lisa to be concerned.    https://t.co/i4mKLcUNG7

name: IA Attorney General

name: IA Attorney General
tweet: In May 2021, the organization came through Iowa again, with 14 reports made and $163,800 lost. This time, thanks to Tina’s hard work, dedication and persistence, members of the Dominican-based criminal organization were identified, and the organization was dismantled.

name: IA Attorney General
tweet: Tina continued to investigate and in January 2021, found that the same organization had come back through Iowa, resulting in 16 reports and the loss of $300,000. Working with agencies in surrounding states, she continued to collect information on the grandparent scam ringleaders.

name: IA Attorney General
tweet: Starting in 2020, Salisbury noticed similar reports about the scam in which couriers were being used to collect money from victims – a new twist on the long-running scam.    https://t.co/yRYux0qLfR

name: IA Attorney General
tweet: A criminal analyst with the Iowa Division of Intelligence and Fusion Center, Tina Salisbury has been an integral part in combatting the so-called Grandparent Scam in Iowa. Her efforts to track and dismantle a criminal organization utilizing the scam are commendable.

name: IA Attorney General
tweet: Have you ever signed up for a gym membership, a subscription service, or other account and then decided down the road that it just wasn’t for you? But when you went to cancel the account, you found the process difficult, confusing, and time consuming?     It's not you. It's them.

tweet: Learn more about tech support scams:   https://t.co/c8TY6k5fFO

name: IA Attorney General
tweet: Congratulations to Spencer and Mary on being recognized at 2022 Attorney General Consumer Protection Hero award recipients this National Consumer Protection Week!    https://t.co/i4mKLcUNG7  https://t.co/j9Lcl8C8R6

name: IA Attorney General
tweet: Since becoming the target of a tech support scam, Mary has worked to inform her fellow community members of the dangers posed online, while Spencer continues to look out for his customers, including Mary, who opened new accounts.

name: IA Attorney General
tweet: Spencer knew Mary and knew her desire to transfer funds was not a normal occurrence. After asking more questions, Spencer told Mary she was being targeted by a scammer. She closed her computer, hung up the phone and closed her bank accounts.

name: IA Attorney General
tweet: The person who answered the phone told Mary her computer had been hacked and those responsible were going to take all the funds from her bank accounts totaling $51,000. Mary called her banker, Spencer Chapman, and asked about transferring her funds to another account.

name: IA Attorney General
tweet: For Mary, the scam came in the form of her computer being controlled by an outside source. A pop-up window instructed Mary to call “MacAfee” to stop the loud noises and bright flashing coming from her computer.

name: IA Attorney General
tweet: Tech support scams come in many forms, but they all try to steal your money or identity.   This National Consumer Protection Week, Mary Stogdill of Grand River shares her story of being the target of such a scam.

name: IA Attorney General
tweet: If you're in the market for renovations to your home, you're not in the clear when it comes to scams, either.   Make sure to research your contractor before agreeing to any plans and never hand over money in advance.   Find out more here:  https://t.co/ZdJDabB5rF

name: IA Attorney General
tweet: Following severe weather, be on the look out for “storm chasers," often out-of-state contractors who swoop into neighborhoods, going door to door, offering their services to repair home damage and clean up debris.    Here's what you should know:  https://t.co/V76Lgt3vWc

name: IA Attorney General
tweet: Like Justice Breyer, she is pragmatic and thoughtful, and she has won praise from both parties for her integrity and intellect. The Senate should confirm Judge Jackson.

name: IA Attorney General
tweet: I applaud President Biden’s #SCOTUS nomination. Judge Jackson would bring a wide range of experiences to the court: as a public defender, a member of the U.S. Sentencing Commission; a trial judge; and as an appeals court judge on the "second-highest court in the land."

name: IA Attorney General
tweet: The opioid crisis never should have happened. While we can't change the past, we can look toward a future where those responsible are held accountable. The funds from this agreement will go a long way toward addressing Iowa’s opioid crisis and provide help to those who need it.

name: IA Attorney General
tweet: In Iowa, all 99 counties, as well as 43 cities have signed onto the agreement. As a result, Iowa will receive its full share of the settlement, expected to be $174 million, which will be split evenly between the state and local governments to abate the opioid crisis in Iowa.

name: IA Attorney General
tweet: I am pleased to announced the final approval of the $26 billion opioid agreement with the nation’s three major pharmaceutical distributors – Cardinal, McKesson, and AmerisourceBergen – and Johnson & Johnson.    https://t.co/P2csEimFi5

name: IA Attorney General
tweet: We want to know, to the extent possible, why this happened, what were the basic factors that caused the price increase, and whether the increases can be explained by supply and demand.

name: IA Attorney General
tweet: Our office has begun to look into unprecedented increases in fertilizer prices affecting farmers. Since January 2021, anhydrous ammonia has increased 315%.  Sudden and significant price increases warrant an analysis into the underlying causes.    https://t.co/6ZG56HBTAk

tweet: Read our letter to the FTC:  https://t.co/SEamJslcvr

tweet: Each year, our office receives hundreds of complaints from Iowans who have been the targets of scammers impersonating government officials, agencies, family members, and others. These are just the tip of the iceberg. The FTC must outlaw these fraudulent acts and protect Americans

tweet: Yesterday, I helped lead a bipartisan coalition of 49 AGs calling on the Federal Trade Commission to adopt a national rule to target impersonation scams.   These scams are a pervasive problem for consumers, small businesses, and charities.    https://t.co/SqWENMTHF9

tweet: While our office has reached a settlement with Centurion, business owners and charity operators must remain vigilant if they receive unsolicited mailers.    https://t.co/vCaV7WF5HO

name: IA Attorney General
tweet: While Centurion may no longer be in the business of sending deceptive mailers in our state, that doesn't mean consumers should let their guard down. Read all mailers carefully and contact government agencies if you are unsure if these letters are legitimate.

name: IA Attorney General
tweet: Centurion misled Iowa businesses and charities during a time when many were already struggling amid the pandemic. We are pleased to come to a resolution with Centurion that provides refunds to 1,200 Iowa businesses and charities.    https://t.co/ohmBs4MNg3
